p.s: The play Disgraced, Scene 3 written by Ayad Akhtar and published in 2013 deals with the problem of assimilation finally leading to a loss of identity as well as the negative meaning and influence of Islam.
It also points out the life of Muslim (looking people) after 9/11 in America.
The given excerpt (p. 71, l. 12 - p. 74, l. 25) deals with Amir losing his control.
Jory and Amir are outside talking about her being offered a partnership at their office.
As they enter Amir's house again Jory sees Isaac, her man, kissing Emily, the wife of Amir.
Jory who is clearly shocked rages as well as Amir who feels treaten unfair.
He go thinks the partnership belongs to him.
Emily refuses to kiss Isaac while Amir still is more interested in complaining about his work.
The tension in the scene raises and Amir and Isaac are facing off as Amir spits him in the face.
Isaac and Jory leave, saying that their boss Mort who had a good relationship with Amir will retire.
Amir asks Emily if she sleeps with Isaac.
She responds she cheated as they were in London excusing herself.
Amir does not respond and hits her three times in the face.
As he comes to his senses Abe, his nephew, knocks at the door, seeing Emily laying on the ground with blood in her face.
